hackathon-description-text: After a week of workshops hosted by the Application Development Initiative, Columbia students are invited to an overnight hackathon to collaborate on innovative projects and develop new skills!
hackathon-rules:
Particpants are required to read and abide by the 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 will be awarded by the panel of judges to the 1st Prize winner
$750 will be awarded by the panel of judges to the 2nd Prize winner
$500 will be awarded by the panel of judges to the 3rd Prize winner
ADI will award a Kindle to the team that builds the Best Civic Hack for Social Good
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Civic Hack for Social Good

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: a16z Andreessen Horowitz will award an Anki Drive to the winner of the Most Technically Impressive Hack
Bloomberg will award a choice of Gaming Console (Xbox One, PS4, or Wii U) to the team that best uses the Bloomberg API
Microsoft will award an Xbox One to the team with the Best Microsoft Hack
Twilio will award four Phonejoys to the team that best uses the Twilio API
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Twilio API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Google will award 2 LG Smartwatches and 2 Google Chromecasts to the team that best uses Google APIs
MongoDB will award an Amazon Gift Card and MongoDB swag to the team that best uses MongoDB
CULPA will award an Amazon Gift Card to the team that best uses the CULPA API
Arya wireless speakers for team with hack that best uses location data!

hackathon-description-header: ADI's annual week of learning and community at Columbia University
